content.question: Which of the following is true of the electoral systems for the legislatures in Nigeria and Mexico?

choices.label: In both countries the lower house is directly elected while the upper house is not.
Mexico uses a mix of proportional and first-past-the-post representation while Nigeria uses only first-past-the-post.
Both have ethnic quotas for legislators.
Mexico’s electoral system includes diversity requirements while Nigeria’s does not.
Legislators in the lower houses in both countries are elected through an alternative vote system.

content.answer: Mexico uses a mix of proportional and first-past-the-post representation while Nigeria uses only first-past-the-post.
